question_html: <!-- HTML_TAG_START -->A vernier calipers has 1 mm marks on the main scale. It has 20 equal divisions on the Vernier scale which match with 16 main scale divisions. For this Vernier calipers, the least count is<!-- HTML_TAG_END -->

options.label: a
options.html:
A
0.02 mm

options.label: b
options.html:
B
0.05 mm

options.label: c
options.html:
C
0.1 mm

options.label: d
options.html:
D
0.2 mm

explanation_html:
In Vernier scale, 16 mm is divided into 20 parts, that is,

1 VSD = 16/20 mm.

Least count = 1 MSD $$-$$ 1 VSD

$$LC = \left( {1 - {{16} \over {20}}} \right)$$ mm = 0.22 mm
